snippet: The Israeli prime minister abruptly canceled a trip to Washington that was to include a visit with President Obama, prompting speculation that a rift between two leaders lingers.
abstract: Decision by Israel's Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu to cancel Washington trip that included meeting with Pres Obama is interpreted by some to mean that tensions still linger between world leaders.

byline.contributor: Isabel Kershner contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

lead_paragraph: The Israeli prime minister abruptly canceled a trip to Washington that was to include a visit with President Obama, prompting speculation that a rift between two leaders lingers.

headline.main: Netanyahu Calls Off Obama Visit, and Fingers Point
headline.print_headline: Netanyahu Calls Off Visit, and Fingers Point
